5 ⲉ psi'on

One argument against an 's' reading is when the consonant is interchangeable with others:
ⲣⲁⲛ (ran) (Sahidic, Bohairic Coptic) reading
ⲗⲉⲛ (len) (Fayyumic Coptic) Lesung/Auslegung :

𓂋 𓈖 suna @ Hausa < •le'sun ⲗⲉⲛ (Fayyumic Coptic) name

however this may be due to change of weak
ⲁ dh ⇔ th ⇔ s ⲉ
ⲁ dh ⇔ gh ⇔ ⲉ s
